intro: Oxydectes californica, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange or red petals and delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oxydectes californica is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known flowering plants like the opium poppy.
